titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elemer Nagy collection ARCH125
titlestmt.author: Ethel Bacon and Margaret Mair, 2007; Transcribed to ArchivesSpace from Word document by Tiffany Crawford, 2016; Joseph Spence and Sean Parke, 2018-2019.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-09-30 15:28:36 -0400.

change.item: Corrected encoding error in the scope and content note of the Artifacts series

repository.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: University of Hartford Archives & Special Collections

did.abstract: The collection contains the works and papers of Elemer Nagy throughout his career as an opera director from 1923-1971. The materials include his set and costume designs, production notes, correspondence and various subject files, as well as a collection of large scenery slides he designed and created for his multi-screen projection system.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection may be protected by copyright law (U.S. Code: Title 17). Any use of the material which exceeds fair use requires permission from the copyright holder. Researchers are solely responsible for obtaining the proper permission(s) for their use of the material.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Elemer Nagy was born in 1906 in Kezdivasarhely, Hungary. He was a multitalented member of the Hartt faculty. As director, set designer, and costume designer, Nagy was the main creative talent behind Hartt Opera productions from 1942-1971.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Unknown [likely Ethel Bacon and Margaret Mair] by 2007; Reprocessed by Amanda Talbot (2018), Sean Parke (2018-2019), and Joseph Spence (2018-2019).

The title of this collection in the original finding aid was unclear, so it was given the title "Elemer Nagy papers and opera collection" in 2015 when it was transcribed to ArchivesSpace because it described the two series of the collection at the time. During the 2018 reprocessing the original title was found to be the "Elemer Nagy Collection," and the name was changed back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The majority of the collection consists of materials pertaining to the creation of opera sets and costumes designed by Elemer Nagy throughout his career as an opera director and stage designer. These materials include colorful drawings, sketches, and tracings of set and costume designs, as well as production notes and large lantern slides he created to project scenery.

The collection also includes photographs of his opera productions, as well as of Nagy, his colleagues, and photographs used for his work. The collection also consists of publicity materials, correspondence and other papers, as well as opera programs and in some cases the designs for the program artwork. There are also two costumes designed by Nagy in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in nine series: I. Set and Costume Designs, II. Scenery Slides, III. Production Notes, IV. Photographs, V. Subject Files, VI. Publicity and Scrapbooks, VII. Opera Programs, Printed Ephemera, and Their Designs, VIII. Artifacts, and IX. Duplicates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Set and Costume Design series consists of drawings of Nagy's costumes and sets. Costumes designs sometimes include fabric swatches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into two subseries: a. Final Designs and b. Sketches and Tracings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These drawings are the final, colored designs by Elemer Nagy of sets and costumes for operas. Occasionally some designs appear to be incomplete, but are much more refined than the kinds of drawings found in the sketches and tracings sub-series.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged alphabetically by opera title.

did.unittitle: Miranda and the Dark Young Man

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In some instances, the original filename included multiple operas with no indication as to which opera each drawing pertained. In these instances, the original filename was retained, and the file was arranged based on the first title in the filename.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series consists of sketches and tracings for costume and set designs. Some of the oversized drawings were created for the large lantern slides which were used for projecting scenery.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries is arranged alphabetically by opera title. In instances in which a file inclues multiple operas, it is arranged by the first title in the filename.

did.unittitle: Marriage of Figaro/Cosi/Magic Flute/Man on the Moon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes two flat file drawer folders of tracings used for Nagy's projected scenery slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains large lantern slides that were created by Elemer Nagy to project scenery for his opera productions. Nagy made these slides primarily with cutouts of various colored transparencies, with additional details drawn on, sandwiched between two pieces of acrylic sheeting.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains notes and documents pertaining to the production of the opera, including set and lighting plans, handwritten notes, casting information, and occasionally music and scripts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by opera title.

did.unittitle: La Boheme - Fort Worth with Placido Domingo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs of Elemer Nagy's productions, as well as photographs of Nagy, his colleagues, his designs, and images he used as inspiration for his work.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged into four sub-series: a. Subject File, Scrapbook, and Publicity Photograph Prints, b. Production Photograph Prints, c. Slides, and d. Transparencies and Negatives.

did.unittitle: Subject File, Scrapbook, and Publicity Photograph Prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series consists of print photographs that were removed from files within the Subject File series and the Scrapbook and Publicity series.

did.unittitle: Scrapbook of Theatre Model Reconstructions by Elemer Nagy

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: During the 2019 reprocessing, many photographs were moved from the Production Notes series to the Photographs series. These Production Notes photographs were initially their own sub-series because they often did not depict the actual production, but were photographs used during the production planning. However, many of these kinds of images were already included with the Production photographs, so the two subseries were merged.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of photographs of Nagy's opera productions, as well as photographs of his designs, and photographs that appear to have been used for inspiration during the design process.

did.unittitle: Devil and Daniel Webster, Storbridge with Paranov

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Magic Flute was the first opera performed in Millard Auditorium.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The slides were originally organized in metal boxes and mostly labelled in letter or number order, indicating the order of the groups of slides (typically grouped by opera title) was purposeful (possibly chronological). However, during the 2018-2019 reprocessing it was not clear what that order was. This is further complicated by the fact that the organization appeared to use two organizational systems (both letters and numbers), as well as files like "Children's Opera" and "Acting Styles" which had their own boxes. The processing information note of each file indicates the label of the original box, and the files are listed in what is believed to be their original order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of 35mm slides of Elemer Nagy's productions, as well as his designs and images he used as inspiration for his work. Some slides may have also had instructional uses.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Moved from Subject series, file "Multiprojection System backstage."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This sub-series consists of negatives and transparencies of Elemer Nagy's productions, as well as his designs and images he used as inspiration for his work.

did.unittitle: Hartt School Operetta, Mrs. Jarvis Awards
Miranda and the Dark Young Man

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes several envelopes marked "Models," "Misc.," "Greek," "Olimpist," "Shop and Technical," and XVII Century."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains various papers of Elemer Nagy by subject, most notable are the files pertaining to his correspondence, his multi-scenery projection system, and televised opera.

did.unittitle: Cooking and Hungarian Buffet Newspaper Clips
Opera takes its staging ques from theatre

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file consists of correspondence pertaining to various programs in which Nagy participated in or directed. This file does not contain opera programs (documents distributed at opera performances), which are located in Series VII: Opera Programs, Printed Ephemera, and Their Designs.

did.unittitle: Radio Opera Comes to the Stage Newspaper Article
Ulysses Kay, Rosa Ponselle, Laurel Hurley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains newspaper clippings, reviews, and scrapbooks regarding the work of Elemer Nagy primarily from 1932-1971. A library newsletter from 2002 about his collection in the archives was added to the collection later.

did.unittitle: Opera at Hartt-A new venture with Schorr, Nagy
Marriage by Lantern Light/Old Maid and the Thief
Marriage by Lantern Light Newspaper Article
Emily Stephenson in Secret of Suzanne
Marriage of the Devil/Secret of Suzanne/Arthur Neuman
Marriage of the Devil/Secret of Suzanne-"Playing from Memory"
Marriage of the Devil/Secret of Suzanne-Expansion-Hartt Opera
Beauty and the Beast/Amelia Goes to the Ball-Columbia U.-Nagy w/ Opera
Barber of Seville-New York City Center
New England Music Critics...Princess and the Vagabond (Freed)
Die Fledermaus scenery and costumes by Elemer Nagy
Mary Washington College of the University of Virginia
Opera Programs, Printed Ephemera, and Their Designs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of copies of opera programs directed by Elemer Nagy, as well as some printed ephemera for these productions. In some cases, the file includes original drawings and designs for these programs and printed materials (drawings and designs are located in oversize box).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by opera title.

did.unittitle: Miranda and the Dark Young Man

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Artifacts series consists of two costumes designed by Elemer Nagy (for Bastien and Bastienne and Don Pasquale), as well as banners used by the Hartt Opera-Theater Guild on their European tour in 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of duplicate materials found in the collection and consists primarily of publicity materials and programs. Duplicate copies of other materials may exist elsewhere in the collection.
